lead_paragraph: The immigration minister, Peter Dutton, suggested that rights advocates bore some responsibility for two recent protests in which asylum seekers set themselves afire.

headline.print_headline: Official Says Activists Give  ‘False Hope’  to Migrants
headline.main: Australia Chides Rights Advocates for Giving ‘False Hope’ to Asylum Seekers

snippet: The immigration minister, Peter Dutton, suggested that rights advocates bore some responsibility for two recent protests in which asylum seekers set themselves afire.
abstract: Australian immigration Min Peter Dutton accuses rights activists of giving 'false hope' to migrants detained in offshore detention centers; suggests activists bear some responsibility for two incidents in which migrants have set themselves on fire on island of Nauru in protest of Australia's immigration policy; insists government will not be pressured into changing policy.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
